Holycow: I dont have a cd I used the upgrade feature.
when you get to the main graphical login screen, click the lower left corner and change session to something other than gnome
I have gnome and beryl and terminal and thats what im using know.
if there aren't any, do   ctrl-alt-F1   then log in and do 'sudo apt-get install fluxbox'  or another window manager, when that's done, exit out of that login and do alt-F8
then log in but select 'fluxbox', once in there you can remove beryl
or you can do  'sudo apt-get remove beryl' from the terminal on ctrl-alt-F1
'sudo apt-get update'  then 'sudo apt-get upgrade'
that's what the updater is doing underneath
Thanks for your fluxbox suggestion it worked a treat
it's a nice simple window manager and it's quite flexible if you read up a bit on how to setup your own menus and keybindings too
if you are new to linux in general, try 'xfce' as well, might be called 'xfce4'
xfce is a middle ground between fluxbox and gnome sorta, more features than fluxbox but not as crazy as gnome and certainly worlds more stable than beryl
Ive used it before. Fluxbox saved me because when you boot using terminal you can only boot one program at time.
also you do know there are many terminals too right?  alt-F1 F2 F3 etc

oh from X you do ctrl-alt-F1 or F2 etc, then from there to get back it's alt-F8 to return to X
